alert.note: Alert for Chickasaw; Fayette; Floyd; Howard; Mitchell (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 14 at 8:37PM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM CST MONDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM MONDAY TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Mitchell, Howard, Floyd, Chickasaw and Fayette Counties. * WHEN...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, until midnight CST tonight. For the Wind Chill Warning, from midnight tonight to 9 AM CST Monday. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 9 AM Monday to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
